column4: hi all! I'm trying to build wine from source ('cus I need to add a patch) on a 64-bit system. However, the config complains about needing 32-bit development files for X, and I can't find them in the repo. Any idea what that pkg is called?
best resource is #winehq
but regarding package name maybe here is good too
yeah I just thought I'd ask here since the wine devs often get upset with distro-specific questions :p
yeah :D
ah a 64 bit sysztem
yes
ah iam on a 32 bit now ,dont know
have 64 at home
okay, I just got some reply at winehq telling me to ask at wine-dev :p
i found a link
btw, there is also a 64 bit wine available
but I need to build from source
did you see this http://wiki.winehq.org/WineOn64bit#head-b62ae8f996e97e1df7258bb8eaec2e83e54ca799
i know buyt you can build a 64 bit wine too it seems :D
ah, nice
hm
anyway I've got this far so I'll just do it the hard way :p
heehaw! 275 MBs of extra files. Yummy.
are you sure you need 32 bit X devel files?
good luck'
yes, the config was very clear on that. However, I just learned that a simple "apt-get build-dep wine1.2" fetches everything I need (and probably more) to build :)
yea taht link is a good read
